original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes weaker at 322/325 to dollar, bonds and t-bills steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s treasury bond and bill yields were steady at close on Monday, dealers said.
“With the IMF extended loan being approved, market is waiting for more clarity on the local debt restructuring.”
A 01.07.2025 bond closed at 30.75/31.00 percent on Monday, steady from 30.90/31.20 percent on Friday.
A 15.09.2027 bond closed at 28.10/60 percent, steady from 28.00/50 percent from Friday.
A one-year bill closed at 24.25/25.60 percent, slightly up from 24.25/25.60 percent.
Sri Lanka rupee closed at 322/325 against the US dollar weaker, from 320/325 from a day earlier. (Colombo/ March27/2023)
